website_summaries.verdict: We recommend the Moleskine as an inexpensive pick for travel or basic journaling.
pros: Paper feels smooth and can handle gel rollers
We like the elastic band to keep everything tight
It's a good basic lined journal with a strong cover for writing on the go
cons: There's no pen loop or pocket in back for extra storage and some pens will bleed through

customer_reviews.title: very thin pages
customer_reviews.text: i’ve used moleskin notebooks as bullet journals before and have never had this problem. the pages are super thin. i’m really disappointed that i payed for a nice notebook to use everyday and its going to look like this.
customer_reviews.author: Alolkoy

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this purchase. My favorite journal was the Piccadilly basic black journal, but when it got discontinued I decided to transfer over to this moleskine. It's over 3 times the price of my piccadilly, but I decide the quality must make it worth the extra money. I was wrong. My gel pens that I used daily in my Piccadilly with no problems bleed through the pages. Even worse, there is a major smudging problem and I'm right handed! I have tried several different brands of pens and they all have this problem. I do not recommend this journal, especially for the price. I will not be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Ohkellygirl

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really particular about my bullet journals. I’ve been using cheaper paperback journals for the last two years and I got this as an “upgrade”, however. I’m not impressed, tbh. I don’t like how the pages are off white, making it impossible to use correction tape if I make a mistake without looking really bad. Also bleed through/ghosting is an issue. I can even see pencil marks. The paper is very smooth, I prefer a little tooth personally. It was also very easy to tear while erasing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Noel

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed. Wish they would keep the paper I experienced ...
customer_reviews.text: Since I started using Moleskine journals I've noticed a decline in paper quality with each journal I purchase. I recently opened a new journal and began writing. The ink soaked through. Which surprised me, because the same ink didn't bleed through on the last journal. The paper on this journal looks and feels different. I'm disappointed. Wish they would keep the paper I experienced with the first journal I purchased a couple years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The only book I ever use for my bullet journals
customer_reviews.text: Extremely high quality notebook for journaling or corporate/professional note keeping. Pocket in the back of the notebook for ticket stubs, photos etc. Ribbon book mark. High quality pages and book bindings and an elastic to keep the book closed. Sleek and professional. I love the grid line version for my bullet journaling and this is the fourth notebook I have bought of this same one and I don't plan to change that. My favorite pen to use with this notebook is the Pilot P-500 extra fine black pen. My sister got me started on this notebook and pen a few years ago and we are hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Analei

customer_reviews.title: Thin paper, expect bleed through
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly disappointed at the quality of the paper. For such an expensive book, I expected to be able to write on both sides of the page without bleed through from regular pens and gel pens. I could understand sharpies, but not to be able to see regular ink through the other side. I definitely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Love moleskine!
customer_reviews.text: Love this journal. I got it to start my first bullet journal. I didn't want to make the expensive leap to the notebook favored by bullet journalers because I wasn't sure how I'd like it (plus they're fastly increasing in price). I've always love moleskine so this is working great for me! There is a little ghosting but no bleed through and you can't even notice the ghosting once you write on the other side. My only complaint is they don't make it in more colors like other moleskine!
customer_reviews.author: Molly G.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is described as having "deluxe quality thick ivory paper perfectly textured for writing with ballpoint pen, fountain pen, or pencil." The paper is thin, and I write with a Parker Rollerball pen which bleeds through to the extent that it will only be possible to use one side of the page. The cover is so fragile that it was bent in two places when the book arrived. I would return it except that I need it now and due to the quarantine am unable to get out and shop for a replacement. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Palmela

customer_reviews.title: Great size, I love to doodle and write in these notebooks
customer_reviews.text: The classic. My dad got me hooked on these when I was a teenager; he has used them for years and years at work. Great size, I love to doodle and write in these notebooks. It's about the size of a paperback book or a standard DVD case. I always buy one before trips so I can plan my itinerary, sketch landmarks and food, and write about my experiences. The pages are fairly durable. Even when you're writing with an ink pen, I find there's little to no bleeding.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for bullet journaling, and its honestly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for bullet journaling, and its honestly perfect. The pages don't bleed even when I'm coloring in a lot, and the open dotted pages are perfect for bullet journaling. It's a great size because it's big enough that you can fit everything on the page and it doesn't get lost in your bag, but small enough that it's not bulky or heavy or overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: elise

customer_reviews.title: pretty color favorite journal
customer_reviews.text: Because I can't pay attention in during lectures and sermons, I take notes in Moleskines, sometimes doodling flowers in the margins. I also write a journal entry every day: prayers, answered prayers, spiritual experiences, adventures, journeys, happenings, milestones, and even a few hints of sadness. I fill 2-3 MS each year. I used to only use black MS, but over the last few years have chosen those with colored covers. This pink is lovely. I feared it might be too bright. However, as with all my other colored MS journals, it is pretty and classy and cheerful. I won't use any other journal.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Usual Moleskine quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the dandelion yellow! Got this to be my next journal. It pairs well with my other Moleskines: a bullet journal, and an 18 month planner. I have Saddleback Leather's medium Moleskine covers for all three of them, so they make a great set. (Look them up on Amazon, they're awesome!) One thing was odd, however -- the first several pages were a tiny bit sticky on the top, but easily separated, no worries. Doesn't detract from the usual quality at all.
customer_reviews.author: seattlewhovian

customer_reviews.title: Check the colors!
customer_reviews.text: I generally love Moleskine notebooks and have been using these for over 10 years. The issue is that this is the first one I have receive where the color in the photo doesn’t match what shows up on your doorstep. I selected the pink one which looks a bit dusty rose in the photo but it arrived and it is is BRIGHT pink. No way I could use this in an office setting.
customer_reviews.author: JMak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Notebook
customer_reviews.text: Moleksine Notebooks are my favorite... and this is a perfect black covered square ruled notebook. The page quality is some of the best and you can find pretty good prices on them here and there if you wait. The hardcover takes a beating and lasts a long time. The pages work well with felt tipped, ball point, rollerball, fountain pens and more. There isn’t a lot of bleed through unless you hold the tip down and pool the ink. I highly suggest Moleskine hardcover notebooks. They are great for art projects, note taking, project work, and overall to do tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Bluevoodu

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality..Ink Bleeds Through Page
customer_reviews.text: I bhave owned many of Moleskin notebooks and this one is the worst. The paper allows the ink to bleed through to the back of the page. You can't write on but one side. Not very good quality at all. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: R. Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook but not if you're looking for non-bleedable pages
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful notebook! It's really awesome. However, since it's more expensive for a notebook, I expected the pages to not bleed through when I write with pens (inkjoy gel pens for reference). The do bleed through. However, since I got this to be a time consumer during the coronavirus pandemic going on right now, I have decided I'll just scrapbook/collage every other page so the pen that shows through is hidden. I'm going to print pictures and put them in as well as scrapbook paper and things. Overall- great notebook, probably a bit too pricey for what it is, but it works for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Uknown

customer_reviews.title: Ink never dries!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start using higher quality notebooks, and this moleskine seemed to tick all the boxes, however trying multiple pens, rolling ball, ball point, etc, they all smudge multiple hours after writing! If i can't write something down and have it stay on the page, let along streak all around once i touch the page, it's back to the cheap drugstore pads which do a much better job with my note.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Making me more hipster than these cuffed denim shorts and beard
customer_reviews.text: Having this item as a status symbol really helps my creative poetry juices flow when everyone is looking at me in this hipster coffee shop. No but really, I have been writing a lot more because it’s just nice to use. I use it for journaling, prayer, poetry, lists and songwriting. Love the strap. Wish there was a good way to attach a pen. I’ve heard the moleskine pen is crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Merritt Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great for Friday 4 O'clock meetings
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy taking my notes with my moleskin along with a pilot precise v5. This combination tackles any meeting and has gotten me through many many meetings. Pros: - Top Tier Quality - No Flashly labels - Simple Cons: - Easy to crease
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stewart Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get any better than this
customer_reviews.text: I use these notebooks for my daily "devotions" in my religious life. I love being able to "pray through a pen", and it's extremely important for me in that process to be able to write without distraction. Moleskine does an excellent job of making a notebook that stays out of the way, allowing me to only think about what I am writing. Put that together with a good gel, black gel pen, and you're in business. I'm still looking for the right pen to fit my routine.
customer_reviews.author: Power User

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had heard good things about Moleskine journals, so I decided to purchase one. Had it about six months before using and I'm highly disappointed. The ink bleeds through the pages and the first page is glued in such a way that it won't open flat. I've already ordered something much cheaper that has thicker pages. I wish I could return this one, but I'll end up ripping out the one page I wrote on and trashing it.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm 92

customer_reviews.title: Love Moleskine, but disappointed with this dot journal.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased various Moleskine notebooks over the years and I’ve always appreciated the aesthetic charm and minimalist look. I wanted to start bullet journaling and thought, “okay time for a Moleskine dot journal!” I was excited to begin journaling, but was highly disappointed when I felt how thin the pages were. The paper cannot hold up to my Zebra Mildliner’s, Pigma Micron’s, or my Tombow’s. I ended up purchasing a cheaper dot journal with thicker pages on Amazon and it holds up much better, with little to no ghosting through the pages. This dot journal would be better suited for ballpoint pen or colored pencils as ink just bleeds through the pages.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Dalton

customer_reviews.title: No Need to Look any Further!
customer_reviews.text: I have many, many Moleskine notebooks...they are perfect for my varied needs. I really like to use these large hardbound notebooks as my Commonplace books, because they are sturdy and the perfect size for recording the various pithy comments and quotations one always comes across, and do not want to forget. These notebooks, together with the weekly planner and assorted cahiers, fit into my fauxdori very nicely, so they are always close to hand. If you are looking for a good notebook, one which will serve you well for a long time, there is no need to look any further than Moleskine!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Concerned about the paper quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Moleskine Notebooks for the last 6 years. Always get them from local stores. Now, because of the pandemic, I ordered this one online. It feels like okay at very first, until I used a highlighter pen. The color soak into the paper and left a mottled pattern... I attached 4 photos. One overall with a pocket size, a Large size and this one ordered online. And three zoom in piece of each. Same light environment, same pen, same iPhone... different quality...
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: I've always been and always will be a Moleskine fan
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, if you haven't tried a Moleskine notebook yet, now is the time. The product material is supreme. The outside cover is solid and smooth. The pages are sturdy and don't bleed, regardless of the type of pen used. The notebooks open up nicely so that you can write on the line next to the seam. The ribbon helps keep your place. There's an inside pocket on the back cover to store notecards and small pieces of paper. It's a win-win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to notebook for writing and for keeping track of my life as a work-at-home homeschooling mom of 5 kids.This is my second Moleskine notebook purchased and they really hold up. The quality is unparalleled and I plan to always purchase this product to help organize my life and do my bullet journaling. I love the pocked in the back and the ribbon bookmark that's attached. I also love that I can keep it held closed and secure so I can keep things inside it.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf5

customer_reviews.title: lovely
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years as daily journals. The quality of the paper makes these a joy to write upon. The cover and strap and back pocket are all handy. Now that my grands send me letters, I stick them in the back pocket. I don't know what my family will do with my big stack of journals after I pass, but at least they are lovely.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Won’t recommend, paper quality is not the same as previous books.
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Dropped the rating down to two stars from five because the quality of the paper is not as good as my previous books. I knew as soon as I cracked the rapping off and touched the paper that it wasn’t the same quality, it’s so thin now, I already know that my sketches are going to push through and my next drawing is going to have marks from my previous sketch. Great for drawing/sketching, I really like the paper and the fact that my sketches don’t get messy between pages.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Kosmo

customer_reviews.title: Pages Bleed
customer_reviews.text: Moleskins are my notebooks to use however I was disappointed with this one in particular. The reason being is the pages are pretty thin so when I use a marker on one side I can see it through to the other. This never happens with any of my other moleskin notebooks and that why I like them so much. Otherwise if this won’t be an issue for you the book is nice and sturdy and will last you a long while. It also looks nice and profesional.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The Pages Are Very Thin
customer_reviews.text: I got this Moleskin Bullet Journal in order to start bullet journaling. After creating my first page I noticed that these pages were incredibly thin and the marker bled right through. This is very frustrating as this journal cost $20 and I have I found journals for $7 that work wonderfully. I don't recommend this journal if you plan on using anything but pencils, because even the lightest pens still bled through. I am very disappointed in this purchase, as Moleskin typically has great products.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Started a new job and wanted a premium notebook. Not impressed with the paper or build quality. The rear of the back cover have worn unevenly in just a few weeks making the back look terrible. Additionally, as others have noted the paper quality is mediocre at best. I use a Pilot G2 (my favorite pen) and each page I have a massive run over several lines. The ink sits on top of the paper. Pretty disappointed. Will be going back to Black n Red for my future needs.
customer_reviews.author: rkdot

customer_reviews.title: This notebook will separate from the binder in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this notebook to go with a medium leather moleskine cover from Saddleback Leather. Began using the notebook during the 2nd week of Jan 2017 and by May 2017 the pages have completely separated from the binder. Very disappointing. I'm going to look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: deserthiker

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas goft
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a Christmas gift (I got to pick it out). I really love it. It is a hard shell so easy to write on. The pages are thin and off white, so it holds more pages than it looks like it does. It has the elastic thing that keeps it together. I only wish it had a pen loop.
customer_reviews.author: Stormie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Item was covered in oil.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these notebooks for years. They work perfect for me. This last shipment was strangely covered in oil. The oil had even seeped through the Amazon envelope and soaked in to some of my other mail. I can't figure out what happened. The notebook was covered in the oil and it seeped through to the notebook cover. Luckily the oil did not penetrate the pages and I was able to use some soap and water to mostly clean it up. Very strange.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Quality. Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. Moleskin. I have been purchasing these for several years and they are WORTH THE PRICE. I have tried other knockoffs and keep coming back because the knockoffs fail in comparison and something just doesn’t hold up. These really are the best. The cover holds up to daily use, the pages hold up, the spine and elastic and bookmark hold up. Qualit. Quality. Quality. You get what you pay for and with this genuine product, you get a sturdy notebook that stands the test of time. I refuse to buy anything else as this is so well made.
customer_reviews.author: MonyMommy

customer_reviews.title: Not liking the change in paper and grid color
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying the same Moleskine notebook for years. However, in the last Molskine notebook I just bought, the paper and grids are slightly different in color than what I've come to expect from Moleskine and have become accustomed to. The paper has a yellow hue and the grid is lighter in color. I don't like it. It doesn't feel like I'm writing on a Moleskine product. In the photo I've attached, my old notebook is on top and the new one is one the bottom. I don't know if this is a permanent change or just a one-off.
customer_reviews.author: Cachis del Real

customer_reviews.title: Bought for use as a bullet journal, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Moleskine notebooks for journals, and I got one to use as a bullet journal. However, the pages are a little too thin to use with pens and highlighters and even some ink or gel pens, and you can see marks on the other side. That being said, because the pages are thin, the notebook itself is very slim and easy to carry around, compared to my Scrivwell notebook (which is much thicker).
customer_reviews.author: shenry

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Notebook
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of different notebooks for work, but have been using one of these for a few years now for my daily grind. While yes, certain gel pens do have a bleed to them, overall with my better pens this thing is fantastic. I definitely love the graphic ruling and as this is moleskin it can take a decent beating. Absolutely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Travy

customer_reviews.title: Quality journal
customer_reviews.text: Would I spend the money to just keep notes or write down grocery lists? No. However, this is a fantastic notebook that I buy year after year to journal in daily. I take it with me when I travel and throughout my regular week. It shows very little wear and tear even when being transported all over. The pages are a great color, very smooth to write on, and thick enough to avoid bleeding through. Great notebook that I will continue to buy year after year.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M

customer_reviews.title: A regular notebook...could find better.
customer_reviews.text: Okay... So I enjoy the history of the moleskine. I like the idea of the moleskine for creative people. However, with that being said... it’s a regular notebook. I’ve even picked up better notebooks than this one that was much more sturdier. The paper of moleskin is really thin. I do like that each moleskine has its own identification number. Having a moleskine makes you feel like the possibilities of creativity is unlimited which is true but it is just a regular notebook. The quality is not superb.
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damage & Probably a Fake
customer_reviews.text: The journal arrived with scratches to both sides of the cover. I went ahead and decided to keep it, because the damage didn't appear to affect the journal pages. But the, based on the quality of the pages moleskine notebook I received, as compared to my previous Moleskine, I believe it might be a fake. I am grtting tons of ghosting using the same pens from I was using in my previous Moleskine journal. VERY UNHAPPY with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Turner

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to store or carry, sturdy notebook. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love these notebooks! They are sturdy, have great solid paper, and an envelope in the back for miscellaneous paper. I love the feeling of the color, and the strap to keep this notebook closed. My colleagues and I only use these notebooks because they’re easy to carry to meetings, put in book bag, and are the perfect size. The ink doesn’t leak through when you write on the pages too - which I appreciate. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It has so many uses!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book for journaling, sketching, and taking notes. The empty pages allow me to have creative freedom with whatever I am doing. The pages are a little on the thinner side so if you have a very pigmented pin there could be some shadowing when you turn the page but it isn't bad whatsoever. Highly recommend these and all of the cute colors!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Thin paper
customer_reviews.text: I own several Moleskine notebooks that I bought a few years ago. This most recent notebook is a disappointment. The paper is so thin that the writing is quite visible from the back of the page. Using a ball point pen, nothing special. There is no bleed through. The paper is just thin. My older notebooks have much thicker paper. For the price of this notebook, the paper is unacceptable. The covers and stitching are very sturdy. I won't be buying any more of these.
customer_reviews.author: P Volkman

customer_reviews.title: Great notebook for any occasion!
customer_reviews.text: This book is my go to book now for taking notes. It has a very professional look that I can take at work, or anywhere else for that matter. It's simplistic, clean look make it ideal for office meetings of any sort in my opinion. It has an elastic band that keeps the book closed when not in use. The exterior cover is made of a solid material that has resisted water spillages in the past. I would only suggest making the pages pre-cut in case you need to rip a page. That would be my only suggestion to the maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Moleskin for the win
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to jump on the bullet journal bandwagon. I've used moleskin notebooks in the past and am smitten with them. I enjoy the pocket in the back and the band that keeps it securely closed. I will say heavy markers will bleed through the pages. I tend to use light pens and I don't have many issues. It's a great size to fit in my bag and I love it. I will definitely be getting another one when I'm ready for a new notebook!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Love Moleskines, don't like getting damaged goods.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 5 stars because Moleskine is the best, but unfortunately the item arrived damaged, with what look like a razor cut on the the spine and one corner bent. I needed it immediately, so I will deal with it, but it's obvious these things happened before it was shipped as the packaging was in perfect condition. It's disappointing, but was a good price and still Moleskine quality inside.
customer_reviews.author: S. P.

customer_reviews.title: My last Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine notebook with a nice elastic band, expandable pocket, and ribbon/ book mark. My problem with it is the page thickness, these pages ghost and bleed through with all of my favorite pens (Pilot G-2 07, Pilot Precise V5, etc.). For about the same money you can get journals of the same quality with paper much thicker ( higher gsm), I will not be purchasing Moleskine products again unless they change the paper gsm and price.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: These notebooks are awesome for fountain pen lovers
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I had a Moleskine notebook that I loved because I could write in it with my favorite black gel pens and have no issues with ink bleeding through. I recently purchased one for my brother, who is an avid collector of fountain pens and hates when ink bleeds through cheaper papers. After giving him this notebook, I believe my brother will now be a Moleskine enthusiast as well. He loves the classic look of the notebook and appreciates the quality of this paper. Highly recommended for personal use, but also makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: V. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Book!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book, along with another, for the writer in my family. The cover is gorgeous, and the quality is amazing. I read about moleskin notebooks in a Stephen King book where a writer used them exclusively. I just knew that I had t have one for my sister. I highly recommend this book to anyone who is a writer, a person who journals, or anyone who just loves to have a beautiful book to keep track of their notes. This was well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: aubie99_98

customer_reviews.title: My First Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: I love this journal! It was well worth the price. Neither the ink or highlighters bleed through the pages and what ever you write is well protected in the hard outer covers. It's a nice size and easy to mold, you don't have to constantly hold one side down while writing. Plus, it has a nice little pocket at the back of it. My only concern is how lose the pages are. I tested it out by gently tugging on a page while I was write and it started to tear from the thread. Other than that it's a very good journal and I plan on using everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Vezsi4kp60

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if looking for high quality paper/binding
customer_reviews.text: Quite dissappointed with this product. If you, like me, were under the impression that moleskine products were of supreme quality, disappointment ensues. There are other niche notebook companies out of Japan (Maruman, spelling could be wrong) and Germany (Leucthrum, spelling definitely wrong) that deserved my consideration. I should’ve checked out offerings on jetpens.com. I succumbed to moleskine to take advantage of prime shipping. The paper quality is horrible, it’s too light and ball-point ink bleeds through, the texture is also not deserving of the $15 price tag. The binding is also quite poor.
customer_reviews.author: Ishaba Haque

customer_reviews.title: This particular one is perfect for my daily journal I keep
customer_reviews.text: I have always and will always use Moleskin journals. This particular one is perfect for my daily journal I keep, the pages to not bleed using a ballpoint or gel pen. I really love that although the pages are lined the lines are subtly and not a dark bold black. I have never had a problem with the spine, elastic on band can be worn down if handled roughly . The size is perfect for my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Good notepad
customer_reviews.text: Great brand of notepad. This is probably the 12th or so one I've bought over the years and their quality has never waivered. They're a bit expensive, but I've yet to find a notebook at the same price point that rivals them. I have one sitting on my shelf that I've used for 3 years to track my major spending, and it still holds together perfectly. Every cheap pad I've tried falls apart before long, and I haven't come across a more expensive pad that is a better quality than moleskin.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Petty

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The pages are too thin, especially when compared to other (cheaper) notebooks that I've used in the past. I use a simple blue ball point pen, and it's difficult to read if you write on the front and back of pages. It also leaves indentions on the next page when you're writing. I expected much better from something that's supposed to be a premium product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this notebook to act as my planner to help keep my thoughts and events organized. I love it the cover looks good and has a nice solid feel to it. The paper on the inside is great quality and I have never had a problem with pens bleeding through it. I have been using this daily for about 3 months taking it everywhere with me and it has shown little signs of wear. This would make a great gift for anyone who loves to plan or jot down their thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kane Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for lefties
customer_reviews.text: Moleskin notebooks are the best on the market. I use these to write down my goals for the year and journal everyday. I’m left handed and they are easy to write in.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small personal notebook
customer_reviews.text: I discovered moleskin notebooks about ten years ago and am a huge fan. They’re perfect for jotting down anything from random thoughts to important information you don’t want to forget. This is a really handy size too. Before I retired I’d use my notebook in meetings to document the discussions and later use my notes to formally write up the meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Standard
customer_reviews.text: Standard journal with squared graph paper of a medium weight. The pages don't hold water particularly poorly, but they are quite thin—if you're looking to get creative with your journal consider another. Most pens ghost or bleed in this, but that's no trouble to me. Be mindful of the spine, as it's prone to tears and is on the thin side, and try not to put this book through the ringer.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Classic Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: I agree that the page thickness of these notebooks is not what it once was. But that aspect aside, it’s still the same high quality notebook we’ve come to expect from Moleskine. It’s definitely durable and has held up to daily use thus far. Still a great brand in my eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Simple and durable
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about Moleskine notebooks. They are durable and have a great, simple design. I will say if you like to write in very thick or dark ink such as sharpie, the pages are thin enough to where it would bleed to the other side. It's also not easy to remove pages, but if you don't plan to do that you shouldn't have to worry about that. Overall love this product and I'll continue to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Finally determined that I love Moleskine ONLY
customer_reviews.text: I'm a journal junky! I've tried many many different brands. I had a gifted journal that had a college logo on it that I liked a lot and wanted another without the logo. After searching all over... finally looked at the back of the college journal and guess what... it's Moleskine!!!! I won't search anymore. Moleskine for me! I bought the red and the blue. I love them. Moleskine Lifer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: absolutely waste of money; disgusting quality
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe I paid $20 for a notebook like this. I purchased the minimalist notebook before and the pages was amazing! this whole time i thought I had bought another minamalist company notebook and was super sad to see the quality of the paper being so bad. I went back to my order randomly and realized this new notebook was actually MOLESKIN AND I HAD PAID $20 WTF? The minimalist notebooks are $8!!!!! I am so mad I cant return it because its been 2 months but wow way to rip off your customers moleskin. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Mooniba Abdul

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Journal
customer_reviews.text: I use this journal for notes at church and our small group. I use a blue Sharpie fine point pen. You can see the shadow of the pen on the next page but it does not bleed through. I love this little journal and plan on buying more in the future once I've used up this puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Expensive little thing
customer_reviews.text: Feels amazing to hold. Pages are durable. Cover is hard which makes it easy to write if there isn't a hard surface. The lines are smaller than I'd prefer to have. The back holding area is small. And for the price it's a very expensive notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lee

customer_reviews.title: Amazon needs to step up its game
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, wish the paper was alittle heavier but mine came with the order of the book crushed in abit so every page corner has some deformation. Just once I’d like to order a book from amazon and have it not come damaged
customer_reviews.author: Cody Novak

customer_reviews.title: Horrible with ink
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for my store brand notebook but it is terrible with ink! My $5 Target notebook never smeared the ink and you couldn't see it from the other side, but this moleskin smeared both my Pilot G-2 pens and archival ink pens. I even tried waiting and dabbing the ink with a tissue and it still smeared. Tried the pens on my old notebook again just in case and instantly after writing they don't smear. Will never buy moleskin again
customer_reviews.author: Craig Suchnicki

customer_reviews.title: Great for a bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first bullet journal and could not be happier. I wanted the dot style but this A5 squared notebook was on sale and I think I lucked out. I love the squares and can't wait to get another one. The paper is perfect for fountain pens and has very little bleed through. If you are reading the bullet journal blogs and see everyone recommending the 1917 Notebook from Leuchtturm, I bought both to find out for myself and you should know that these are equally good but I got this one at almost half the price of the other. Get one and you will see for yourself why Moleskine is so highly regarded!
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Faulkenberry

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook with a Couple of Flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really like this notebook for the elastic band and the pocket in the back of the book. That being said, in order to make this notebook "ready for use" you will have to tape the bottom of the pocket, where it meets the back cover opposite the spine, or it will rip and everything your notebook holds dear will fall onto the ground. It's an especially great feature if you keep business cards back there and are reaching for one. Really makes you look professional. I digress. You will also need to tape the back page (where the pocket is) where the page meets the spine or it will rip there as well after prolonged use.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Robust Notebook for Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: I have re-ordered this notebook three times. I absolutely love it for keeping daily notes. It helps me keep track of all my daily “to-do” items. The hardcover is great for protecting the pages within. Most notebooks tend to fall apart from the spine after weeks of daily use. This notebook holds up great!!! Recommend over all other products
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect daily journal
customer_reviews.text: Some years ago I finally broke through my irrational frugality and purchased a Moleskine notebook to use as a daily journal. I've been using Moleskines ever since and have a collection of uniform, date-labeled notebooks on my bookshelf. It is pleasing to have them organized and neat on the shelf as opposed to the boxes of mis-matched spiral notebooks and pads of paper I used to use. I gave this item four stars rather than five because they are a little pricey. For me, though, it is worth it. For anyone who records their thoughts regularly, I would encourage you to honor those thoughts--your personal history--in these classy little volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Lana VS

customer_reviews.title: #Regret
customer_reviews.text: Sought to replace a leather-bound moleskine with an elastic pen holder. Regrettably received this cardboard unit sans pen holder. #Regret
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as my Bullet Journal
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Moleskine, so of course I've been using the squared notebooks for my Bullet Journals. The Large is just the right size for what I've been using it for. It's a classic notebook with lay-flat smooth pages for writing ease. The lines are the perfect height for me since I write small with fine-medium point pens. I love the attached bookmark so that I can easily go to my "Today's task list" easily, while the elastic closure band keeps it closed so that it doesn't flop open by accident. The pocket in the back comes in handy to stash small slips of paper. The Squared Notebooks really are perfect for bullet journaling.
customer_reviews.author: Pleasure Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Better options
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. Compared to my other notebooks of similar price, this is just not worth it. Leuchtturm has it beat for paper quality, construction and features -table of contents and page numbers- it's my pick for gel pens. Rhodia webnotebooks are my current favorite for use with fountain pens - heavy smooth nonabsorbent clairfontaine paper and built to last construction. The paper quality and binding on the moleskine are just lacking... for the same price as the others. Red and Black notebooks for a cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: I love this notebook
customer_reviews.text: I love this notebook! I use this for work to attend meetings, jot down ideas, tasks,etc. The grid is 5mm in length which is perfect for me. The corners of the pages are rounded so they don't fold or bend. The binding is sturdy, the bookmark very useful, and i feels good in the hand. The color of the paper is off white, which is nice because it doesn't feel like its too bright like printer paper. The cover is heavy enough that it stays closed when laying flat on a desk and when open the pages don't stick out. Cant say enough good things about this little notebook. IT IS WORTH IT. BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Erick 3E

customer_reviews.title: Durable, long-lasting notebook
customer_reviews.text: Moleskine is my go-to notbook for work. Especially as someone who uses fountain pens, the paper allows slight bleed, but has a wonderful texture that doesn't smear. The ribbon is helpful in providing a quick open spot for the next new page and the back pocket keeps a good number of business cards so I don't have to carry them in a separate folio.
customer_reviews.author: J. Snavely

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brand of notebooks!
customer_reviews.text: When the journal arrived, it came in a plastic wrap and paper cover on the outside, in brand new condition. Moleskin is my favorite brand of notebooks and Amazon did not disappoint (as I know sometimes people do not get the actual product). The feel of the cover and pages are great and the pages are good enough to use gel pens without leaking (although I would not use heavier pens). I've been using these books for almost seven years for journalling and I love them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Thin paper...pen ink bleeds straight through
customer_reviews.text: If you’re an avid gel pen user, this IS NOT the journal for you. I use pilot G-2 gel pens and Zebra Sarasa gel pens, and both bleed through the pages considerably. The pages are super thin, and definitely do not take ink well. I wish I could return this “defective” product...
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Tomczuk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect BuJo!
customer_reviews.text: This notebook makes a perfect BuJo! The paper is a little thin, but it works for my needs. However, the color was very different from the image on the listing. I thought it would be a dusty blue, but it was bright turquoise, so I painted it with acrylics (which stay on the journal pretty well with a matte clear coat, if anyone was wondering). Overall, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: I will use nothing else for work, ever again. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this notebook for years and was delighted when I ordered a replacement most recently and discovered that it now has a bookmark ribbon as well as the elastic it has always come with. I love everything about this notebook - the pages and line spacing are perfect, the color is great, the elastic and bookmark are super useful. Very sturdy and opens perfectly flat. Beautifully stitch bound. Oh, and it has a neat little portfolio fold-out pocket in the back. Should I be this excited about a notebook??
customer_reviews.author: Brianne

customer_reviews.title: It's a classic, but there are better options
customer_reviews.text: It has a satisfying weight and pleasant texture on the cover and paper but the cover gouges and scratches very easily. It's nice if you're trying to go for that heavily-used look but it would be nice to have a little more durability. The paper is a bit smooth to the touch which makes it a little harder to write on with lower quality ballpoints which is what gives this a four star.
customer_reviews.author: TopGun4815

customer_reviews.title: A notebook for particular people that arrived in very poor condition.
customer_reviews.text: The notebook is great. I've had many of them, but this one arrived in terrible shape. I needed it for my notes and my only option was to send it back and obviously I cannot lose my notes. How does a return policy benefit me if i have to send my notebook back to get a new one? As it is I'll have to copy all my notes at least once, I'm not trying to do it twice!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Wowk

customer_reviews.title: Best notebook out there!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Moleskine notebooks for quite a few years now. I love their durability. This size 5" x 8.25" has been great for business meetings as well as my personal journal. The pocket in the back is great for receipts or little notes that have been given and the strap keeps everything together. I could not recommend this notebook enough!
customer_reviews.author: Heath Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: Ghosts quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: The book is well made and everything as it should be, feels great to the touch. The only complaint is that the pages are quite thin and ghost a little too much for my liking. both fineliners and gel pens show through on the back a bit. the paper takes fineliner okay but gel ink seems to not absorb into the paper and also smears easily. I expect a little better paper for a $15 small notebook. probably will try the leuchtturm in the future, but nevertheless, still a very beautiful notebook and I will continue using it. If the paper took gel ink better and was slightly heavier to prevent ghosting, it would be a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: QY

customer_reviews.title: Gone downhill-- pages too thin
customer_reviews.text: I always keep a journal and have used Moleskine in the past. The pages are way thinner now. I wish I would have bought another journal from Peter Pauper Press instead. Cheaper and nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the scent of a new book, and this one got a nice scent. The pages are not too thick or too thin for writing with a ballpoint pen. There's no mistakes in the one I received. Perfect quality. My only concern is the hardcover material. I've never felt anything like it. I can't stop touching it before opening it to write in it. I would buy more of this.
customer_reviews.author: Chanelle

customer_reviews.title: Love Moleskine Books
customer_reviews.text: This is just as sturdy and solid as any other Moleskine book I've purchased in the past. I really like the dotted pages for drawing room dimensions and sketches! Definitely a great price for a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best Notebook-Timeless for those of us still taking notes!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best hard bound notebook around. Rhodia copied the style, but not the paper or construction, nor durability. Have used these for years and will continue. I'm a consultant, and I can refer back to notes from prior years in my notebooks and they look like they were just written. Their long history and celebrity usage is simply a testament to good design and manufacture in the age of throw away notebooks, and cheap glued spines that leaves one with loose sheets over time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcanthony Salvatini

customer_reviews.title: but if you need something durable nothing takes a beating like a hardcover Moleskine
customer_reviews.text: I have dozens of notebooks, and this is the only one that can survive a year of daily use and being tossed around in my bag. They're pricey, but if you need something durable nothing takes a beating like a hardcover Moleskine. The paper doesn't bleed either, which is nice, although there is some ghosting. I also love that the lines are faint enough to not distract from your writing.
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: Best. Journals. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: If you have never had a Moleskine I highly suggest getting one. For casual or serious writers, there is good reason this company's products are a standard for so many creators. Just buy it, thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: davidwilliamdurney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect notebook
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these Moleskin books and I’ve always loved them. A great price for an awesome notebook. I bought this particular book for a friend of mine who was going to start a new work project, and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Quality stuff
customer_reviews.text: Let it be known that marker pens bleed through just a bit too much for my liking. I was hoping to use this for my bullet journal but the pages are barely too thin. Oh well, it is still a very good quality notebook for general use.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Martin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite notebook
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Moleskine notebooks/journals for years now. It's highly possible that I've used just about every style they make...hardcovers, kraft covers, reporter's style, large, small, etc. Along the way, I've also used journals/notebooks from other companies. I always come home to Moleskin though. Nothing stands up to the wear-and-tear of daily use like a Moleskine. I use them for both personal writing, for cataloging notes for research/artistic projects, etc. These books get a workout from me, and they come back for more when lesser products have already fallen apart. They're that well-made. My favorite is the squared, with a hard back cover. I come back to them again and again.
customer_reviews.author: CJL

customer_reviews.title: compact professional notebook with graph paper style I enjoy
customer_reviews.text: clean, professional, compact notebook for notes, minutes, etc. As an engineer, I feel safer with the graph paper. It reminds me of a joke. "What does an engineer use for birth control? His personality"
customer_reviews.author: Tiberius Gemellus

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping a journal
customer_reviews.text: The hardcover supports both sides of the pages. What I mean is, sometimes with the cheap notebooks, it feels easier to write on the side with more pages underneath than the other one (with hardly any). This notebook's cover supports both sides so you get an even writing experience. I use it with an ink pen and the pages are thick enough that nothing blotches on the other side. The book mark is useful and unobtrusive, the elastic clip keeps it from opening while in the bag and so you dont have dog ears. Lastly, because I paid so much for it, I know exactly where I kept it so I can go and write when I need to!
customer_reviews.author: Saurav Shrestha

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for what I use them for
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for what I use them for. Taking notes in my graduate courses. They are small and easy to keep track of, not to mention the quality is awesome. Yes, people will say you can just buy multiple 1 or 3 subject notebooks for a fraction of the cost, but when your notes actually matter and need them for future reference then this will keep them safe and easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality notebook and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these notebooks. A couple of times I’ll buy less expensive ones but I’m always disappointed and come back to these moleskin notebooks. They’re great quality, last, and feel fantastic. You can bring them into any meeting and feel confident.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: The Moleskin quality you expect is no longer there.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Moleskin, large. squared, notebooks for years and have always been a fan of Moleskin notebooks. What happened? My new book has fallen apart! The sewn in page sections are loose and fall out. Are Moleskin notebooks now made in Chinese or Indian factories by underpaid workers? Have the MBA'a carved the value out of the notebooks? They are not the same quality that I expect. I would return the notebook to Amazon, but I have already started to use the book. Anyway, be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Sengi96

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love moleskin products. They are amazing by every means. I have gone through 3 of them already. This particular one looks elegant as it is a hardcover and fits in all bags. Low profile notebook for jotting things down. Great seller since the product arrived on time with no issues. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: I have used this nearly everyday and I love the pocket in the back
customer_reviews.text: I have used this nearly everyday and I love the pocket in the back. The grid is well straight on all pages and doesn't skip. The exterior is what fascinated me. I am not "easy" on my books so I simply shoved this into my bags wherever I went. The pages held up very well and there were no tears, there are a few dings on the cover but they came out as minor dings even after a was rough with the book.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

product_meta.title: Moleskine Classic Notebook, Hard Cover, Large (5" x 8.25") Ruled/Lined, Black, 240 Pages
product_meta.description:
Style:Ruled| Color:Black

This basic yet classic Large Ruled notebook is one of the best selling Moleskine notebooks. This reliable travel companion perfect for writings thoughts and passing notes has a cardboard bound cover with rounded corners acid free paper a bookmark an elastic closure and an expandable inner pocket that contains the Moleskine history.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Classic Collection featuring bold new colors and a variety of page layouts just waiting to be filled with your ideas. Including all the characteristic elements of the legendary notebook: rounded corners, ivory pages, elastic closure, bookmark ribbon and expandable back pocket - enclosed within a colorful hard cover. - Colored Hard Cover Classic Notebook 
- Rounded corners
- Elastic closure 
- Moleskine ivory paper
- Matching ribbon bookmark 
- Paper: 70 gsm, acid-free, ivory, lined
- “Incase of Loss” printed on the flyleaf
- Expandable inner pocket in the back
- Reusable paperband B-SIDE featuring additional printed tools
- Lies flat, opens at 180° 
- The history of Moleskine is inside

- Moleskine Srl creates and sells FSC-certified products
feature_bullets: CLASSIC MOLESKINE NOTEBOOK: Moleskine classic notebooks are perfect notebooks for writing journals, a daily diary, or note taking in college classes or meetings. Moleskine notebooks are beloved by travelers & bullet journalists for their slim design.

DURABLE COVER & ELASTIC CLOSURE: Hold writing projects & notes in your Moleskine notebook with an elastic closure band & inner storage folders. Leather-like classic Moleskine cover & thick, ivory paper pages are perfect for writing with fountain pens.

GIFT QUALITY NOTEBOOKS: Moleskine planners, journals and notebooks come in hardcover or softcover and colors like black, red, blue, green and brown. The binding and cover have a durable finish, designed for daily journaling, writing and sketching.

DELUXE QUALITY PAGES: Moleskine's thick, ivory paper pages in a hardcover Moleskine notebook, softcover Moleskine notebook, cahier or volant journal, or Moleskine planner are perfectly textured for writing with a ballpoint pen, fountain pen, or pencil.

MOLESKINE QUALITY: We're dedicated to culture, travel, memory, imagination, & personal identity—both physical & digital. We bring this commitment to our notebooks, bags, apps & smart pens & notebooks.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,568 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
